result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie James Cokely

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie James Cokely not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Willie James Cokely.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the Court that Mr. Cokely is in Ozaukee County Jail and requests another status conference.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Zoom appearances approved by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie James Cokely appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Willie James Cokely.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is still waiting on medical records and is requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie James Cokely in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden. Both parties appeared via zoom. Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Willie James Cokely in court, appear by video with Student Intern Audrey Johnson appear by video with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Andrew Golden advised the court that the defendant is in custody in the state of West Virginia. Attorney Golden advised the court the defendant will not be released until June 23, 2022. Court will imposed by stay bench warrant until next court date and  adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie James Cokely in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel. Court appoints attorney Andrew Golden, present in court in court via Zoom, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 06-01-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed
Indigency hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:36 AM Defendant Willie James Cokely in court in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie James Cokely in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Willie James Cokely in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie James Cokely appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.    DEFENDANT MAY NOT BE INDIGENT due to employment. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 2 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
